meta.description: Require constructor names to begin with a capital letter

content.introduction:
Require constructor names to begin with a capital letter
Table of ContentsRule DetailsOptionsnewIsCapcapIsNewnewIsCapExceptionsnewIsCapExceptionPatterncapIsNewExceptionscapIsNewExceptionPatternpropertiesWhen Not To Use ItVersionResources
Thenewoperator in JavaScript creates a new instance of a particular type of object. That type of object is represented by a constructor function. Since constructor functions are just regular functions, the only defining characteristic is thatnewis being used as part of the call. Native JavaScript functions begin with an uppercase letter to distinguish those functions that are to be used as constructors from functions that are not. Many style guides recommend following this pattern to more easily determine which functions are to be used as constructors.
